com.team1829.library

Class CarbonUI

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.team1829.library.CarbonUI

  • public class CarbonUI
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is the core for all of the Operator needs pertaining to any USB controllers. The structure here is such that any action that the robot needs to perform based on Operator input may be defined by it's name, and then the resource which controls it may be separately manipulated. For example, for driving, typically Joystick Axes are used for either a Tank Drive or Arcade Drive. To assign controls for each, you would define methods such as "getArcadeXAxis()" and "getArcadeYAxis()". These methods would return the raw joystick value of the axis which was assigned to each of those actions, regardless of which physical thumb-stick was assigned. These assignments are also dynamic, and they may be changed at any time. The way to assign controller resources to an action is to create a PORT variable and an ID variable for the action inside the UIConfig class (which is a sub-class inside of CarbonUI). These PORT and ID variables for the action need encapsulation (getters and setters). Then, a method is needed in CarbonUI which has a return type which is the same as the value being retrieved from the USB controller. The name of the method should reflect the action which is using the resource. Note: If more than one action all refer to the same USB controller resource, they should both have unique action methods in CarbonUI and unique ID and PORT variables in the UIConfig. This way, a chance in the resource for one action will not unintentionally remap the resources for another action.
    Author:
    Nick Mosher, Team 1829 Carbonauts Captain

    • Constructor Detail

      • CarbonUI

        public CarbonUI()
        Creates a new CarbonUI object. Each CarbonUI can have different configurations, so different users could instantiate their own CarbonUI's and add their own control preferences into them.

    • Method Detail

      • addControl

        public void addControl(java.lang.String name,
              CarbonUI.ControlType type,
              int port,
              int id)
        Adds a control object to the CarbonUI.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the control object.
        port - The USB port the control object is on.
        id - The ID of the control object.

      • removeControl

        public boolean removeControl(java.lang.String name)
        Removes a control from the CarbonUI.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the control to remove.
        Returns:
        True if the process completed successfully, i.e. a control with the name 'name' was found and removed. False if no matching control was found and removed.

      • getButtonData

        public boolean getButtonData(java.lang.String name)
        Gets the data from a button control object based on its name.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the button.
        Returns:
        The button's status.
